intro: Dichapetalum stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dichapetalum, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
